I led an investigation into how one drug manufacturer exploited the #opioidcrisis by increasing the $ of its naloxone by >600%. The company used a distribution model that encouraged patients to bypass more affordable & equally effective alternatives for a more expensive product.

The Prescription Drug Pricing Reduction Act passed by @SenFinance today also includes my amendment requiring @HHSgov to study the influence of drug manufacturer distribution models that encourage patients & taxpayers to pay more for drugs when more affordable drugs are available

Each year, #Medicare & private health insurers waste nearly $3B on cancer medications alone that are thrown out because the drugs are packaged in vials that hold too much for most patients. The bill @SenFinance passed today to crack down on high prescription drug prices includes legislation I co-authored w/ @SenatorDurbin to allow #Medicare to recoup $ from drug companies that were paid for wasted medications, saving $ for seniors & taxpayers.

The bill I supported today & passed by @SenFinance, will help lower out-of-pocket costs for our seniors, cracks down on the high prices set by drug manufacturers, ends the practice of spread pricing in Medicaid & saves taxpayers more than $100 billion.   https://bit.ly/2Y1t8xP
With #Medicare & #Medicaid paying more & more for prescription drugs, high prices are also increasing costs to taxpayers & that’s why it’s important for #Congress to act.

Earlier this year, @POTUS signed my bipartisan legislation to again reauthorize HABs & Hypoxia Research and Control Act to help #Ohio communities minimize any economic, ecological, & human health impacts of harmful algal blooms, giving millions of #Ohioans peace of mind.

We must ensure GLRI has the resources to protect and preserve our Great Lakes and as co-chair of the Senate Great Lakes Task Force, I will continue to help lead efforts in the U.S. Senate to protect funding for this bipartisan initiative.  https://bit.ly/320i1lL

The #GreatLakes are critical to #Ohio’s fishing industry, provide drinking water for 40M people, contribute billions in tourism each year, & support thousands of #jobs across the region. I’m grateful the Senate included my bipartisan amendment to increase funding for #GLRI.

This increase brings the total amount of Senate-passed funding for #GLRI to $310M for FY 2020,  the largest investment in the Great Lakes’ health, ecosystem, and water quality. #GLRI has already helped combat harmful algal blooms, invasive species, & pollution in the Great Lakes.

The #GreatLakes are an invaluable resource to #Ohio, & #GLRI has been a successful public-private partnership that helps protect both our environment & our economy. Yesterday, the Senate-passed funding bill included my bipartisan amendment to increase funding for #GLRI by $9M.

In my summer travels across #Ohio, I learned a lot from #Ohioans about their priorities & what they need from the federal gov. This fall, I’ll continue to fight for all #Ohioans & make sure we’re passing legislation that makes a positive difference in people’s lives.

My travels across Ohio also allowed me to meet with farmers, the backbone of an agricultural industry that contributes more than $100 billion to #Ohio’s economy every year. We discussed how heavy storms have hurt the ag. community this year & the need to pass #USMCA.

I also met w/ a number of groups working to combat the addiction crisis across #Ohio. State & local organizations have been able to use federal resources provided by laws like my #CARA and #CURES to design innovative approaches to preventing and treating addiction.

I discussed my bipartisan #JOBSAct with community colleges, high school #CTE programs, and businesses all across #Ohio, as it will help close the skills gap and get more individuals into short-term training programs.

I met with #smallbiz owners who told me how they’ve benefited from the major #taxreform law enacted in 2017. They’ve used their tax savings to grow their businesses, increase wages for their workers, & hire more employees. We also discussed the need for skilled workers.

It was a great opportunity to learn more about the priorities of Ohioans across the state & how DC can help. I was able to see firsthand how some of the laws I’ve passed are working to address the #opioidepidemic & expand workforce training. #SORGrants #CARA #STOPACT #JOBSAct

This summer, I traveled more than 4000 miles across #Ohio in my pickup & had 75 meetings w/ farmers, #smallbiz owners, factory workers, police officers, drug counselors, recovering addicts & others in 39 #Ohio counties. More in my column for @delgazette:  https://www.delgazette.com/opinion/78868/what-ohioans-told-me-in-august …

I’ve introduced common-sense, bipartisan legislation called the Trade Security Act to require DoD to justify the national security basis for new tariffs under Section 232 & increase congressional oversight. The Senate should pass this bill.

I’m glad the admin delayed imposing these tariffs, but minivans manufactured in Canada are not a national security threat to the US. We must rein in misuse of the Section 232 trade law while preserving this trade remedy tool for genuine threats to national security.

I do not, however, support the idea of imposing tariffs on auto imports. This morning, the admin confirmed that its Section 232 investigation by the Commerce Dept. found that imports of autos & certain auto parts are a national security threat to the US.

I support the admin’s efforts to open new markets to American-made products around the world, to hold #China accountable for cheating and level the playing field for our workers & to modernize our trade agreement w/ Mexico & Canada. #Jobs

I’m grateful for the support from @OhioAG Dave Yost & all 56 state and territorial Attorneys General for the #FIGHTFentanylAct. They understand the urgency of passing this legislation so we can permanently protect all Americans from deadly fentanyl-related substances.

Last year, I introduced the #FIGHTFentanylAct to permanently criminalize these deadly substances to bolster our efforts to keep fentanyl-related substances out of our communities. I urge my colleagues to support this important legislation before the order expires next month.

I introduced bipartisan legislation w/ @SenBobCasey today to reduce the hoops seniors have to jump through in order to receive their Medicare. The Enrollment REFORM Act protects #smallbiz from unfair out-of-pocket costs while also limiting the bureaucratic obstacles seniors face

I will continue to work with my colleagues to rid our communities of drugs like meth, cocaine and opioids and helping individuals who are suffering from addiction get back on their feet.  https://bit.ly/2XilcHp

I introduced the Combating Meth & Cocaine Act to give #Ohio & the rest of the US more flexibility to use the State Opioid Response funding to address the resurgence of meth & cocaine, which will better address the on-the-ground reality of addiction in #Ohio & across the country.

While I’m pleased that #Congress has provided significant resources to combat the #opioidcrisis in states & local communities, the State Opioid Response Grant cannot be used to combat the drug crisis beyond opioids.

When I talk to law enforcement, treatment providers & others on the frontlines of the drug crisis, I am increasingly hearing about the resurgence of methamphetamine & cocaine overdoses across #Ohio.  https://bit.ly/2XilcHp

This morning, I am chairing a bipartisan Permanent Subcmte on Investigations hearing with federal agencies about how best to improve online comment process, & ensure Americans have a voice in rulemaking process. Watch live here: https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/subcommittees/investigations/hearings/review-of-e-rulemaking-comment-systems …

I’m hopeful that this bipartisan report will start a discussion between Congress & the federal agencies about how we can make online comment systems work better both for government agencies and the American people.  https://bit.ly/2p0xXXZ

However, the online comment systems are too often being abused, & agencies have not taken adequate steps to address that misuse. Victims of identity theft are being misrepresented on federal govt websites & agencies are doing little to protect them.

The online comment process provides Americans with the opportunity to voice their opinions & provide meaningful input to federal agencies, while ensuring that these agencies have the best info possible when proposing new rules and regulations.

We can’t take our eyes off the broader issue of addiction. While we’ve begun to see progress in combating opioid addiction, other drugs are making a resurgence. Cocaine & meth are on the rise which is why I’ve introduced legislation to open up State Opioid Response grants to the current addiction crisis.

These sorts of breakthrough programs are making a difference, but there is still a long way to go. That’s why I was pleased that @HHSgov recently announced that #Ohio would receive more than $55M in additional State Opioid Response Grant funding to help sustain these efforts.

This summer, I had the opportunity to ride-along w/ Columbus Fire Department’s RREACT team & see firsthand how they're working to combat the opioid addiction crisis. RREACT is using an $800,000 #CARA grant on an intervention program w/ skilled rapid response teams.

Thanks to our local law enforcement there’s less heroin & fewer RX pills on our streets. What’s more, first responders are receiving funding through my bipartisan #CARA & #CURES law that is being used in innovative new approaches to ensure individuals receive treatment & recovery

Finally, the #FY2020NDAA also expands existing financial protections for Gold Star military families’ residential and car leases & posthumously promotes Lt Col Richard Cole to Colonel, the last of the living Doolittle Raiders until he passed away earlier this year.
This legislation also improves coordination across the federal government in identifying and responding to emerging contaminants like per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) in our drinking water.

#FY2020NDAA imposes mandatory sanctions on foreign banks & companies that facilitate illicit financial transactions for #NorthKorea, holding them accountable for their actions & human rights abuses against Otto Warmbier as well as others they’ve illegally held captive.

The NDAA also directs the @DeptofDefense to brief Congress on how they are developing and prioritizing explainable artificial intelligence & to provide Congress with a comparative analysis and briefing on U.S. and #Chinese AI capabilities.

And #FY2020NDAA authorizes $300M in security assistance for #Ukraine’s forces, sending a clear message that the US stands w/ the Ukrainian people in their struggle to secure a democratic, prosperous, and independent future in the face of Russian aggression.
#FY2020NDAA authorizes $120.9M in funding to finish construction at #NASIC located at the @WrightPattAFB.
#FY2020NDAA authorizes $394 million for upgrading Stryker Vehicles at the JSMC in Lima, #Ohio & $523 million for purchasing 152 Stryker A1 Vehicles to be built.

#FY2020NDAA authorizes $1.7 billion in funding to upgrade 165 Abrams tanks, increasing the rate of production of the upgraded Abrams tanks Joint Systems Manufacturing Center (JSMC) in Lima in order to ensure that our forward deployed tanks have the most cutting-edge capabilities.

The #FY2020NDAA includes a number of initiatives I’ve fought for to support #Ohio’s military installations, increase troop pay, support our veterans & their spouses, enhance our cybersecurity & provide additional assistance to #Ukraine:

I’m humbled by the support @SenatorCardin and my bipartisan Retirement Security & Savings Act has received from key stakeholders who support bipartisan reforms to help Americans save more for retirement and increase their 401(k)s.  https://bit.ly/2R53X9m

Since the 2001 Portman-Cardin bill became law, 401(k) and other DC plan assets have increased by 179% and savings in IRAs have more than tripled.  U.S. retirement savings have increased from $11.3 trillion in 2001 to $28.3 trillion today. But we have much more to do.

The 2001 Portman-Cardin measure more than doubled contribution limits to IRAs, allowed portability between different types of retirement plans & allowed older workers to make catch-up contributions to 401(k)s and IRAs.   https://bit.ly/2R53X9m

The legislation builds on the previous success @SenatorCardin & I have had in authoring major reforms to enhance the retirement system as members of the House of Representatives that became law in 1996, 2001, and 2006.   https://bit.ly/2R53X9m

My bipartisan Retirement Security & Savings Act will help to increase Americans’ savings in IRAs and workplace savings plans, expand coverage, and simplify retirement plan rules so Americans can enjoy a financially secure retirement.  https://bit.ly/2R53X9m

Americans work hard to support themselves & their loved ones, they shouldn’t have to struggle to save for retirement. That’s why @SenatorCardin & I have introduced bipartisan legislation to strengthen American’s retirement security.  https://bit.ly/2R53X9m

We have the best workers in the world in #Ohio, and I’m proud of the workers at Lordstown. They make a great product, and the UAW made concessions there. We have proven ourselves time and again. Let’s put the new product in Lordstown, @GM.
We can and should do more to ensure more cars are made in #Ohio and America, and that’s what the new tax law actually does by incentivizing companies to invest and create jobs here.
In addition, lowering our corporate tax rate to 21% actually makes doing business in the United States far more competitive, especially compared to Mexico’s 30% corporate rate.
This incentive should reduce the tax cost to the investments that would likely need to be made to the plant to bring in a new vehicle there.

Under the tax law, companies making capital expenditures are now able to deduct 100% of the cost of those investments in year one instead of having to follow complicated depreciation schedules over many years.
I’m hopeful that @GM will make a wise decision and utilize the tax law’s benefits of immediate expensing and a lower rate to retool the Lordstown plant and bring a new vehicle there.
We’ve seen countless multinational companies responding to this new level playing field by bringing jobs and investment back into the U.S. in response to the new tax law.

The new tax law was designed to encourage companies to bring back jobs and investment to the U.S. through a competitive corporate rate and our new international tax system & it’s having a positive effect on our economy.

In fact, the opposite is true. Through a lower corporate rate and immediate expensing, the tax bill incentivizes companies to invest in the U.S. and would help GM bring a new vehicle to the Lordstown plant.
I’m disappointed in @GM’s decision to shut down the Lordstown plant because the Chevy Cruze was not selling well. To be clear, this decision has absolutely nothing to do with the new tax law.
